data.text: @JakeSherman @PunchbowlNews Taking credit for vaccine distribution? LMAOOO the army already had the operations and supply chain logistics in place since the Trump admin for that. The Biden admin literally did nothing

@southboundhome This isn’t about you, obviously. I’m clearly talking about others who aren’t doing these things. 

And no, there is no excuse for denying reality just because “i’m tired of covid 😡“. If you think covid gives a shit about how tired you are, that’s a you problem, get out more.

@candomora Man, I’ve done & am doing most of that. As far as being angry on Twitter & yelling at right wingers, I’d rather go out to dinner & spend time with family. 

But if you think there aren’t people with real & legitimate reasons to want to move on, that’s a you problem, get out more.

@southboundhome The average person could get vaxxed, wear a mask, push back on right wing lies, take covid more seriously, & stop pretending there’s nothing to be done. Of course I’m angry at people who deny reality just because “they’re tired of covid”. What kind of person would be ok w/ this?

@candomora Man, I’m not sure if you’re aware, but I can’t much do any of those things. Maybe call your congressperson? What is it you want the average person to do differently? You s m ti just be angry, and I can empathize, but it seems misdirected.

@southboundhome To start with:
-Improve indoor ventilation/filtration 
-Encourage masks & provide N95s
-Increase access to at-home testing
-Get everyone boosted
-Guarantee paid sick leave
-Fight back against harmful misinfo from the right

Giving up and pretending this is over is not the answer.

@Uncorporated @your_juannonly @jwilcox79 Why? The fact that zero death is a ridiculous goal doesn’t mean we can’t prevent some deaths sometimes. My issue was with the idea that “every covid death was avoidable” I have no idea how anyone could even come up with such a stupid statement.
@candomora What. Are. The. Steps? 🤷🏻‍♂️ I’m interested in hearing them.

@southboundhome I’m advocating for not pretending covid is over just because we’re tired. There are many steps we could take 
to reduce the odds of future variants (which could easily dodge vaccines or be more deadly in general). It’s insane that people are just giving up.
@southboundhome The right has consistently downplayed covid, failed to vaccinate adequately, refuse to take even basic steps to keep others safe, and continually mock people who do care. Fuck them.
